title: NDP 2026: Getting into the Show
description: NDP's Good Afternoon. A contractor accidentally ran a script that wiped the production database. You have 3 hours before the gates open. The last backup is 6 hours old. Go.
storyContext: It's 1:30pm on NDP afternoon. You're half awake at your desk when the Slack channel explodes. A contractor ran a cleanup script against the wrong database, and the production data is gone. The last backup is 6 hours old. Gates open at 4:30pm. Three hours to bring it all back, with 40,000 people expecting a working app when they walk in.

software-engineer.title: Rescue the Database
software-engineer.instruction: The live database was just wiped. Restore it before 40,000 people walk through the gates. One wrong step and data is gone for good. Put the rescue steps in the right order.
software-engineer.hint: First, stop anything else from being destroyed. Then work out what was lost. Then fix it. Only switch things back live once you are sure.

items.label: Immediately stop all new data from being written so nothing else gets corrupted
Compare the current state against the backup to see exactly what was lost
Restore from the 6-hour-old backup into a test environment first, not live
Replay the record of actions from the last 6 hours to recover the most recent changes
Run checks to confirm everything looks right, then switch the live app over to the restored database

data-scientist.title: Recover the Lost Data
data-scientist.instruction: The wiped database included 6 hours of user activity that marketing needs for their NDP social media campaign. The raw records still exist in a separate system but they are messy and unprocessed. What is your plan?
data-scientist.hint: Something useful delivered in time beats something perfect delivered too late. But think about whether the data is even still relevant.

options.label: Reconstruct all the missing data from raw records. Takes 2 hours but marketing gets complete and accurate numbers for their campaign.
Use a sample of the records to estimate the missing numbers in 30 minutes. Accuracy drops to about 85% but marketing gets something useful in time.
Skip recovery and set up better tracking for NDP day itself. The actual show data will be far more valuable than rehearsal week numbers anyway.
Ask marketing to match their social media numbers against whatever data you can salvage. Not perfect, but fills the gaps by working together.

cloud-engineer.title: Rebuild the Infrastructure
cloud-engineer.instruction: The whole system needs to come back online. Drag each part to the right slot. Slot 1 is the first thing to restore. Slots 2 and 3 can run at the same time. Slot 4 is your final check before going live.
cloud-engineer.hint: The thing everything else depends on must come back first. Think about what the app absolutely cannot work without.

items.label: Backup Database (handles lookups when the main database is busy)
Speed Cache (remembers common answers so the main database is not swamped)
